byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt and Mike McIntire contributed reporting.
byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and STEVE EDER

abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton had email domain registered to server linked to her home in Chappaqua, NY, in 2009, when she became secretary of state; private email allowed her to shield her correspondence, and getting account from her domain became status symbol within Clinton family's inner circle, bestowing prestige and closeness to her.
lead_paragraph: A domain name set up for Hillary Rodham Clinton shielded her correspondence and was used for coveted accounts that conferred prestige and closeness to the secretary of state.

headline.main: Membership in Clinton’s Email Domain Is Remembered as a Mark of Status
headline.print_headline: Membership in Clinton’s Email Domain Is Remembered as a Mark of Status

snippet: A domain name set up for Hillary Rodham Clinton shielded her correspondence and was used for coveted accounts that conferred prestige and closeness to the secretary of state.
